intro: Stackhousia brunonis f. simplex, commonly known as the simple stackhousia, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family and is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and pale pink to white flowers. The plant typically grows in heathlands and sclerophyllous forests, preferring well-drained soils. It is a shrub that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, and its foliage is often dense and compact. This variety is noted for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its attractive appearance.
